feedback: Critical: Fix the invalid color token in css/styles.css (:root --elev: #fffff). Use valid hex (#ffffff) or a CSS color name; invalid values can break theme vars and color-scheme behavior.
Hero: Include the product name 'LoopPilot' in the hero headline or subheadline so the brand is prominent (tests expect the task keyword to appear in page content, not only meta).
Skip link: Remove or fix the empty '#top' link; ensure the primary skip link points to an existing id (e.g. #main) with visible link text and is the first focusable element.

FAQ accordion: Confirm each question control has aria-expanded and aria-controls, corresponding content panels have matching IDs and role='region' (or aria-hidden when collapsed). Ensure Enter and Space toggle behavior is implemented and tested via keyboard.

Form: Add HTML5 required/type attributes to name, email, and message fields (required, type='email'). JS may show friendly messages, but must not override native validation; use aria-invalid and aria-describedby when showing custom error text.
Images/SVGs: Add explicit width/height or use CSS aspect-ratio for inline SVGs/placeholders to reserve space and avoid layout shifts (CLS).

Focus styles & contrast: Ensure visible focus-visible outlines for all interactive elements (links, buttons, form controls) and verify color contrast >=4.5:1 for body text; adjust tokens if any combination fails in dark mode.

Dark mode & tokens: Verify prefers-color-scheme overrides all color tokens (no hard-coded colors that break dark theme). Test both modes to ensure legibility and that the 'Most popular' pricing highlight remains perceptible in dark mode.
Smooth scroll & reduced motion: Ensure smooth-scrolling respects prefers-reduced-motion (skip animation if user prefers reduced motion) and that the JS is non-blocking and free of console errors.
Pricing: Make the 'Most popular' tier visually distinct AND semantically clear (e.g., a badge + aria-label='Most popular' on the plan container) so screen reader users get the same emphasis.
Navigation: Remove duplicated nav links shown in the browser summary and ensure sticky nav has appropriate z-index and does not obscure focused elements when scrolled-to anchors are targeted.
Documentation: Confirm README includes the brief run/open instructions, design tokens (color vars, breakpoints), known limitations, and notes about accessibility testing and browsers used for QA.

headings.text: Close the loop. Ship what matters.

buttons.text: How does the free trial work?
Do you support SSO and role permissions?
Do you offer discounts for nonprofits?
